text: Moderate-certainty evidence found that there are likely to be small numbers of women with cervical cancer before the age of 30 years (3/100 000 at age 20; 5/100 000 at age 25; and 12/100 000 at age 30), and a small proportion of women between the ages of 15 and 29 years with CIN2 or $\mathsf { C l N 3 + }$ (1400/100 000 and 700/100 000, respectively; Web annex A, Supplementary materia 4).
